required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Lovaza (Omega-3-Acid Ethyl Esters) in Recurrent, Symptomatic Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Lovaza for the Prevention of Recurrent, Symptomatic Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate efficacy and safety of Omacor (omega-3-acid ethyl esters) in patients with recurrent, symptomatic atrial fibrillation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal AF With an Event of Documented Symptomatic Atrial Fibrillation (AF)/Flutter
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
primary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF /Flutter was defined as AF/Flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. The occurrence of symptomatic atrial flutter was treated as an occurrence of symptomatic AF for this outcome measure. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF or flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Persistent AF and in Both AF Subgroups Combined With an Event of Documented Symptomatic AF/Flutter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. The occurrence of symptomatic atrial flutter was treated as an occurrence of symptomatic AF for this outcome measure. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF or flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal AF or Persistent AF With an Event of Documented Symptomatic AF (Exclusive of Atrial Flutter)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in Both AF Subgroups Combined With an Event of Documented Symptomatic AF (Exclusive of Atrial Flutter)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number Participants With Paroxysmal or Persistent AF With an Event of Documented Symptomatic or Asymptomatic AF/Flutter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic or asymptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Asymptomatic episodes of AF or flutter were recorded by TTM during routine bi-weekly transmissions. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF/flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in Both AF Subgroups Combined With an Event of Documented Symptomatic or Asymptomatic AF/Flutter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic or asymptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Asymptomatic episodes of AF or flutter were recorded by TTM during routine bi-weekly transmissions. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF/flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal or Persistent AF With an Event of Documented Symptomatic or Asymptomatic AF (Exclusive of Flutter)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic or asymptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Asymptomatic episodes of AF were recorded by TTM during routine bi-weekly transmissions. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF/flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in Both AF Subgroups Combined With an Event of Documented Symptomatic or Asymptomatic AF (Exclusive of Flutter)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the first symptomatic or asymptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Asymptomatic episodes of AF were recorded by TTM during routine bi-weekly transmissions. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF/flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal or Persistent AF With an Event After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF/Flutter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From completion of Day 7 of study drug to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in the Combined AF Subgroups With an Event After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF/Flutter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From completion of Day 7 of study drug to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal or Persistent AF With an Event That Occurred After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF (Exclusive of Flutter)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From completion of Day 7 of study drug to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in the Combined AF Subgroups With an Event That Occurred After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF (Exclusive of Flutter)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From completion of Day 7 of study drug to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Number of AF/Flutter Rescue Episodes During the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the last dose of study drug (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: Rescue was defined as any pharmacological/electrical/surgical intervention for the termination/prevention of AF/flutter with a maximum of one rescue episode counted per day. Note: all annualized values were calculated by counting the number of rescue episodes, dividing by the number of days on treatment, then multiplying that number by 365.25.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Cumulative Frequency of Symptomatic AF/Flutter Recurrences During the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the last dose of study drug (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: Values were annualized by counting the number of episodes of symptomatic AF/flutter recurrences (maximum of one per day), dividing by the number of days on treatment, then multiplying this number by 365.25.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Cumulative Frequency of Symptomatic AF Recurrences During the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the last dose of study drug (up to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: Values were annualized by counting the number of episodes of symptomatic AF recurrences (maximum of one per day), dividing by the number of days on treatment, then multiplying this number by 365.25.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women age 18 years or older
- History of symptomatic atrial fibrillation (either paroxysmal or persistent)
- Provide written informed consent and authorization for protected health information disclosure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Permanent (chronic) atrial fibrillation
- Antiarrhythmic drug therapy which cannot be stopped
- Use of amiodarone with prior 6 months
- History of unsuccessful cardioversion
- History of certain cardiovascular conditions or cardiac surgery within prior 6 months
- History of stroke within prior 6 months
- Implanted cardio-defibrillator
- Certain circulatory, thyroid, pulmonary, liver, kidney, musculoskeletal or metabolic conditions, or cancer (except non-melanoma skin cancer)
- Poorly controlled diabetes

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

results_reference.citation: Kowey PR, Reiffel JA, Ellenbogen KA, Naccarelli GV, Pratt CM. Efficacy and safety of prescription omega-3 fatty acids for the prevention of recurrent symptomatic atrial fibrillation: a randomized controlled trial. JAMA. 2010 Dec 1;304(21):2363-72. doi: 10.1001/jama.2010.1735. Epub 2010 Nov 15.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

group.title: Paroxysmal AF, P-OM3
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (AF) receiving P-OM3, 8 grams (g) per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24. Paroxysmal AF was defined as AF that had never been treated with pharmacologic/electrical therapy to terminate an episode. A documented episode of symptomatic paroxysmal AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF in the participant's medical record.

group.title: Paroxysmal AF, Placebo
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal AF receiving matching placebo. Paroxysmal AF was defined as AF that had never been treated with pharmacologic/electrical therapy to terminate an episode. A documented episode of symptomatic paroxysmal AF was defined as AF documented by an ECG or TTM tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF in the participant's medical record.

group.title: Persistent AF, P-OM3
group.description: Participants with persistent AF receiving P-OM3, 8 g per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24. Persistent AF was defined as AF that had been terminated at least once with pharmacologic/electrical cardioversion. A documented episode of symptomatic persistent AF was defined as AF documented by an ECG or TTM tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF in the participant's medical record.

group.title: Persistent AF, Placebo
group.description: Participants with persistent AF receiving matching placebo. Persistent AF was defined as AF that had been terminated at least once with pharmacologic/electrical cardioversion. A documented episode of symptomatic persistent AF was defined as AF documented by an ECG or TTM tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF in the participant's medical record.

A documented episode of symptomatic persistent AF was defined as AF documented by an ECG or TTM tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF in the participant's medical record.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF /Flutter was defined as AF/Flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. group.description: Participants with persistent atrial fibrillation (AF) receiving P-OM3, 8 g per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24

measure.title: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal or Persistent AF With an Event After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF/Flutter
measure.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter.
measure.population: MITT Population. Participants with events that occurred in the first 7 days were excluded from analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants in the Combined AF Subgroups With an Event After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF/Flutter
outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter.
outcome.time_frame: From completion of Day 7 of study drug to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF/flutter (up to Week 24)
outcome.population: MITT Population. Participants with events that occurred in the first 7 days were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Combined, Placebo
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal and persistent AF receiving matching placebo

group.title: Combined, P-OM3
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal and persistent atrial fibrillation (AF) receiving P-OM3, 8 g per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24

measure.title: Number of Participants in the Combined AF Subgroups With an Event After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF/Flutter
measure.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter was defined as AF/flutter documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. Atrial flutter, a closely related rhythm disorder, was distinguished from AF by the presence of distinctive flutter p-waves at regluar intervals. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF/flutter.
measure.population: MITT Population. Participants with events that occurred in the first 7 days were excluded from analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Paroxysmal or Persistent AF With an Event That Occurred After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF (Exclusive of Flutter)
outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.
outcome.time_frame: From completion of Day 7 of study drug to the first symptomatic recurrence of AF (up to Week 24)
outcome.population: MITT Population. Participants with events that occurred in the first 7 days were excluded from analysis.

"Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.
measure.population: MITT Population. Participants with events that occurred in the first 7 days were excluded from analysis.

outcome.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.

group.title: Combined, Placebo
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal and persistent AF receiving matching placebo

group.title: Combined, P-OM3
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal and persistent atrial fibrillation (AF) receiving P-OM3, 8 g per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24

measure.title: Number of Participants in the Combined AF Subgroups With an Event That Occurred After Completion of Day 7 to the Occurrence of Symptomatic AF (Exclusive of Flutter)
measure.description: A documented episode of symptomatic AF was defined as AF documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or transtelephonic monitoring (TTM) tracing associated with symptoms consistent with AF. "Censored" in the table below refers to participants who did not have a documented episode of symptomatic AF.
measure.population: MITT Population. Participants with events that occurred in the first 7 days were excluded from analysis.

outcome.title: Annualized Number of AF/Flutter Rescue Episodes During the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Rescue was defined as any pharmacological/electrical/surgical intervention for the termination/prevention of AF/flutter with a maximum of one rescue episode counted per day. Note: all annualized values were calculated by counting the number of rescue episodes, dividing by the number of days on treatment, then multiplying that number by 365.25.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the last dose of study drug (up to Week 24)
outcome.population: MITT Population. The number analyzed represents those participants who had a rescue episode.

group.title: Paroxysmal AF, Placebo
group.description: Participants with paroxysmal AF receiving matching placebo

group.description: Participants with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (AF) receiving P-OM3, 8 g per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24

measure.title: Annualized Number of AF/Flutter Rescue Episodes During the Treatment Period
measure.description: Rescue was defined as any pharmacological/electrical/surgical intervention for the termination/prevention of AF/flutter with a maximum of one rescue episode counted per day. Note: all annualized values were calculated by counting the number of rescue episodes, dividing by the number of days on treatment, then multiplying that number by 365.25.
measure.population: MITT Population. The number analyzed represents those participants who had a rescue episode.

outcome.title: Annualized Cumulative Frequency of Symptomatic AF/Flutter Recurrences During the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Values were annualized by counting the number of episodes of symptomatic AF/flutter recurrences (maximum of one per day), dividing by the number of days on treatment, then multiplying this number by 365.25.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug (Day 1) to the last dose of study drug (up to Week 24)
outcome.population: MITT Population. The number analyzed represents those participants with an event.

reported_events.desc: Serious adverse events (SAEs) and adverse events (AEs) were collected in the Safety Population, comprised of all participants who received and took at least one dose of study medication. Events reported are "treatment emergent," defined as an event of new onset or one that worsened during the on-treatment period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants receiving matching placebo

group.title: Prescription Omega-3 Acid Ethyl Esters
group.description: Participants receiving P-OM3, 8 g per day for the first 7 days; 4 g per day thereafter through Week 24

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
